metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8694 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient access control in the Linux kernel driver for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-123-generic - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-123-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-123-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-123-generic - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-123-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1087-gcp - 4.15.0-1087.100~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1058-oracle - 4.15.0-1058.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-194.226').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1087.100~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.64~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
